intro: Pleiocarpa flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered pleiocarpa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
